reviewText: A classic. Zita johann, star of "The Mummy" w/Boris Karloff in 1931 had that indefinable star quality. She's been forgotten by most but deserves lasting film recognition.
Lets put it this way: Zita Johan is built NOTHING like the artwork on the cover, OK ?

I bought this for its curiosity value and am satisfied with the purchase. The picture is a low-budget effort but more to the point its makers were not very experienced, so the writing and direction are amateurish. The cast is good, but they can only do so much with the material. What makes it worth seeing is that it is intended to arouse prurient interest, to be luridly sensational, and fit succeeds.
Great classic movie. I love Zita Johan in the Mummy with Boris Karloff so I just had to get this one.
Pre-code (Hayes) plot that includes adultery and murder combined with well done special effects we take for granted today.  Worth a look.
